title: Comvision pong
body: Classic pong game, but you control the paddle's position with the index finger. This computer vision project used @mediapipe library to detect hand landmarks, and game logic was written in javascript. Visuals were rendered with html5 canvas component.

title: live-signlanguage-translator
body: This project is a live sign language translator. It uses machine learning to translate sign language into english. It uses python to train a model, and uses tensorflow to run the model. The model is trained on a dataset of sign language signs, and the dataset is generated from the sign language dataset of the sign language translator project.

title: pokerchips
body: This webapp hosted on AWS elastic beanstalk allows the counting of poker chips easily, for the times when you don't have coins or chips available.

title: GuniCorn
body: We built an online donation system to make the process easier for both donors and recipients. Our project won 1st place at NUS Lifehack 2021. I built the front-end application as well as the backend Rekognition API.

title: wordle-solver
body: This project makes use of information theory to solve wordle puzzles, utilising concepts based on the video by 3Blue1Brown

title: sudoku-solver
body: This application solves sudoku puzzles using a backtracking recursive algorithm. The user interface is coded with Pygame to allow users to easily input puzzles.

title: sorting-visualiser
body: See how sorting algorithms work with interact website! Supports bubble sort, insertion sort, merge sort and quick sort. Built with pure html, bootstrap for formatting, and lots of flex box :D

title: Elderberry
body: This was our project at Huawei Spark Hackathon 2022 which won 2nd place. We built a smart home system for seniors and caregivers, and I build the React Native Caregiver app as well as the Swift Watch Application.

title: blackjack-q-learning
body: Q learning (Reinforcement learning) with blackjack to see how much I can raise the odds of winning by...

title: pokerchips
body: This webapp hosted on AWS elastic beanstalk allows the counting of poker chips easily, for the times when you don't have coins or chips available.
